twitterp

Class TwitterAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • twitterp.TwitterAPI

  • public class TwitterAPI
extends Object
    Simplified interface to twitter4j for programming beginners. Intended to be useful for beginners who do not yet know what objects, classes, and exceptions are. Also useful for anyone who just wants a simplified interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwitterAPI

        public TwitterAPI(processing.core.PApplet theParent,
                  String consumerKey,
                  String consumerSecret,
                  String accessToken,
                  String accessTokenSecret)
        Constructs a new Twitter API instance. To receive status updates, your Processing app must implement this method: void onStatus(Status status){ }
        Parameters:
        theParent - parent applet.
        consumerKey - Twitter API consumer key
        consumerSecret - Twitter API consumer secret
        accessToken - Twitter API access token
        accessTokenSecret - Twitter API access token secret.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public void filter(String... filters)
        Filter all tweets, receiving current statuses that contain the supplied search term. Multiple strings may be supplied. Do not include hashtags -- if you want to filter hashtags only, you'll have to exclude the # symbol from the filters argument, then manually check each received status.
        Parameters:
        filters -

      • filterUsers

        public void filterUsers(long... idsToFollow)
        Start receiving status updates from users whose IDs are in idsToFollow.
        Parameters:
        idsToFollow - the list of IDs to follow

      • filter

        public void filter(twitter4j.FilterQuery query)
        Filter an arbitrary FilterQuery. See Twitter4j docs for more details.
        Parameters:
        query -

      • filterGeo

        public void filterGeo(double swLat,
                      double swLon,
                      double neLat,
                      double neLon)
        Filter based on geographical location. Specify a bounding box, by supplying the SW corner first (latitude, then longitude), then the NE corner.
        Parameters:
        swLat -
        swLon -
        neLat -
        neLon -

                          String status,

        status - the status to add
        imageName - a name for the image.
        Returns:

      • makeStreamFromPImage

        public InputStream makeStreamFromPImage(processing.core.PImage image)
                                 throws IOException
        Implementation copied from LGPL source in Processing's PImage class. Unfortunately, the code wasn't factored to allow reuse :( Currently, this implementation stores the image in memory as a JPEG, then sends it. A future implementation might optimize this and start streaming the JPEG before it is fully constructed.
        Parameters:
        image -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • tweetImage

        public boolean tweetImage(String imagePath,
                          String imageName,
                          String status)
        Tweets the supplied image plus a status. Uses the same logic for resolving file paths as Processing's loadImage and loadStrings functions.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - path to the image (a local path relative to the data folder, an absolute path, or a url.
        imageName -
        status -
        Returns:

        public static String version()
        return the version of the Library.
        Returns:

      • extractImages

        public processing.core.PImage[] extractImages(twitter4j.Status status)
        Extracts an array of PImages from a given status.
        Parameters:
        status - the status to extract images from
        Returns:
        PImage objects representing the loaded images. Returns a zero-length array if the status contains no images.

      • extractFirstImage

        public processing.core.PImage extractFirstImage(twitter4j.Status status)
        Extracts the first image from the supplied status.
        Parameters:
        status - the status to extract images from
        Returns:
        PImage object representing the loaded image. Returns null if the status contains no image.

      • search

        public twitter4j.QueryResult search(String queryStr)
        Search Twitter using the given search query. For more on writing queries, consult Twitter's guide: https://dev.twitter.com/rest/public/search

      • searchImages

        public processing.core.PImage[] searchImages(String queryStr,
                                             int limit)
        Search Twitter posts for images using the supplied query string. Returns at most limit images.
